title: Home Workout - No Equipment

In just a few minutes a day, you can build muscles and keep fitness at home without having to go to the gym. No equipment or coach needed, all exercises can be performed with just your body weight. The app has workouts for your abs, chest, legs, arms and butt as well as full body workouts. All the workouts are designed by experts. None of them need equipment, so there's no need to go to the gym. Even though it just takes a few minutes a day, it can effectively tone your muscles and help you get six pack abs at home. The warm-up and stretching routines are designed to make sure you exercise in a scientific way. With animations and video guidance for each exercise, you can make sure you use the right form during each exercise. The app has workouts for your abs, chest, legs, arms and butt as well as full body workouts. All the workouts are designed by experts. None of them need equipment, so there's no need to go to the gym. Even though it just takes a few minutes a day, it can effectively tone your muscles and help you get six pack abs at home.

The warm-up and stretching routines are designed to make sure you exercise in a scientific way. With animations and video guidance for each exercise, you can make sure you use the right form during each exercise.

summary: Home workouts for fitness & fast bodybuilding at home - no equipment needed.

scraped_reviews.content: this app is actually super helpful. I did one workout and it was actually great. everything was accurate and the day after, I was really sore. and I also like that you can target certain parts of your body and they have a variety of options to work out just one or more part(s) of your body. i would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to get stronger. Good Job guys!!

Good app used it, and everything's going fine, making progress, good for anyone without any equipment and actually trying to stay fit at home. Edit: I wanted to leave a more detailed review: Before each workout theres rest time and you can increase it as much as you want, theres also detailed instructions on how you should breath, how the exercise is performed, and the correct techniques even videos, after each session they ask how it was and if they should make it easier, harder or the same.

So far only installed the app, answered all the questions, paid for pro account and am looking at the plan for the 1st day. It includes 50(!) push-ups of different types (after I mentioned I could do 5-10), 3 exercises which need equipment (in a no-equipment app) and one jumping exercise (after I mentioned I got knee issues and would prefer not to have jumping exercises). This plan doesn't look personalized at all, it seems random or standard.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andreas, we understand that everyone has different fitness levels and recovery needs. Your suggestion is valid and something we will definitely consider. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we are continuously working to improve the app to meet the diverse needs of our users. Thank you for helping us become better.

scraped_reviews.content: Great app best part is that is free and if you find a workout hard it will make an easier plan for you. Based on your end goal there are workout plans. Thanks to the team. You are making impact. Updated review Aug 10: The app keeps getting better. Currently there is switch exercise button. If you don't like an exercise or can't do it at home you can switch it for another similar exercise. Also, many workouts can be opened by seeing an ad. There are exercises for all levels.

(Edited) This app keeps improving, and I use it every day. Lots of different plans, so you can choose the best for your needs. You can progress as fast or as slow as your body accepts. You can modify existing workouts: change reps, exercises and their order; delete exercises; but, bizarrely, you can't add to a workout (no response from the dev about this üôÅÔ∏è). It synchronises over the cloud, a blessing when I got a new phone. This app has proven its worth to me for years already.

Love this app so far, I can already feel myself getting stronger because of it and it really only takes a few minutes out of my day. One thing I don't like though is that it and the notifications it sends are a LOT more focused on looking good/developing a figure rather than getting stronger, I don't exactly care for losing weight, what I care for is getting stronger.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Shemaiah, thanks for your valuable feedback. We attach great importance to user's needs and we have communicated your suggestions to our development team. Thanks for your support. We'll continue to improve our app to bring you a better experience. Best regards.

scraped_reviews.content: 3rd time down loading this app, first time round barely used it, struggling to finish 2-28 day challenges in a year. 2nd time used more getting 5 1/2 challenges in a year. lost phone and saw there was a new updated version. I work out at home and don't want or am able to buy expensive equipment so I love the no equipment needed routine. have and will recommend not only this plan but any and all of "LEAP FITNESS" apps. also downloaded there dumbbell, and stretching apps. Thank you Leap FITNESS

I have been using this app for over 3 years and I am so grateful for it!! It has EVERYTHING . From stretches to workouts at every level...and if you do everything right you WILL see results .. other than some adds its perfect .. it's gotten me the strongest I've been . Amd completely balanced . Since it has separate work outs for different muscles . Consistency should be put in from your end. And if you want more you can add weights in, just wish there was more back work outs!!

It's free, it's great, it actually works, it has animations to teach you how to do it and gives you tips you let you know how you would know if you are doing it wrong. Did I say it's free! It has a few ads that aren't intrusive. I wish it had a nutrition guide, too, since nutrition goes together with exercise. I am using it, and I m happy. This is beginner friendly 100%

Great app for working out without all the gym equipment. There are three levels to choose from in the different areas of the body that you want to work on. There is also an option to work on the whole body. After each exercise the app will ask you to rate the exercise plan too easy, a little easy, a little hard, too hard or just right and then it will adjust your next exercise session accordingly.

I'm using this to get back into shape so I can enlist, it allows you to choose how hard or difficult it will be, and even allowed me to choose if the tasks were too hard to do. It's helpful and the videos are also great for if you don't know how to do something. I also appreciate that you can add time to the breaks in case you still need a moment. Just a great app to me and I would recommend it to most. Adds are short and pop up less than most apps so it's also handy.

I'm about a week in so far. I didn't expect much since I'm using the free version but I'm pleasantly surprised. Even without paying, the workout coaching does a great job at putting together a personalized routine for me. A short ad pops up after doing a challenge and I don't mind it. Instead of paying monthly for the workouts that aren't included in the free version, there's just a 30 second ad to wait for. Maybe not for everyone but it works for me.

I don't go to gyms as a rule, so this app is right up my ally. After completing week one, not consecutive either, I feel more strength and energy than I had before. I also have a bad back and neck and after a couple days of consecutive work outs I feel the pain diminishes to a completely manageable level, being almost nothing as opposed to what I'm used to. I would definitely recommend this app.

The workouts are generally good and require little to no equipment. I only wish it offered a finer-grained way to tailor the workouts to my abilities (beyond just rating how hard an entire workout was). For example, in the beginner ab workout, I've always felt that the leg raises are 100x harder than all the other exercises combined. The app tells me how to make some exercises easier--just not the one that is actually too hard for me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Ravi, thanks for your valuable feedback. We attach great importance to user's needs and we have communicated your suggestions to our development team. Thanks for your support. We'll continue to improve our app to bring you a better experience. Best regards.

scraped_reviews.content: I like using this ap. It's at my pace, as far as when I want to workout. The workout itself shows great demonstration and the muscles that you are working. Great balance of time in exercise, with a rest in between, so you can catch breath if needed, or transition from floor to upright. I use this ap as a filler, or an add on, so that I can keep strengthening my core.

I started with the six pack in 30 days app, and it was very good. there was a program and i got resalts. I then went to the arm work out with the same experionce 5 stars. So when I downloaded this app i was excited for the options it offerd with chest, legs and back, but it was dissapinting with only three exercises of varying difficulty for each with no program, This is not what I expected. Also some of the exercises are not relevant to the area of the body that is supposably being worked.

Just download this app. Seriously. It's exactly what we all need. I travel for work and I have struggled over the years with a workout routine that allows me to exercise, regardless of where I am located, rain or shine. Hotel gym equipment is inconsistent at best, this allows me to remain consistent. The progression from Beginner then Intermediate to Advanced has worked perfectly for me. I haven't tried the other programs ... but I assume they are just as effective and varied. Just try it.

I love the fact that their main exercises are free and you can purchase extra premium exercises if you want to. All the other apps I've tried you have to pay for a subscription, but for those of us who are looking for a free or cheaper option, this app is awesome and the free exercises are great! They're hard, but you can make them easier or harder, depending on what level you are in your fitness regimen. This is a great fitness app & I NEVER give 5 stars, but I'm giving this app 5 stars!

Ok. Third review: the expanded content and annual membership is something that is worth the investment. I would like to see another "challenge workout" that spans a few weeks or so, but I do enjoy the variety that they have. Previous review(s) from 2019 and shortly after released.... was 5 star, had a great concept, free version is still 5 star thiigh it can get repetitive after a while. 9.99 a month? No thank you, theres plenry of small gyms that offer almost the same price for a membership.

Great workout. I really enjoy it. It felt a little easy at first, but the workouts seemed to update as I provided more feedback after each workout. They got more challenging and longer. I am on week 4 of the 28 day challenge and wish it was longer. recommend this to anyone trying to get in shape, especially if they are trying avoid injuring themselves and want to shape their physique.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we understand that everyone has different fitness levels and recovery needs. Your suggestion is valid and something we will definitely consider. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we are continuously working to improve the app to meet the diverse needs of our users. Thank you for helping us become better.

scraped_reviews.content: I think this is a great app. I just finished a 28-day "full body challenge" (available on the free tier) and I appreciate how it gives you a variety of exercises every day. My only complaint is that every 3 or 4 days it gives you a workout that is all pushups, and as you ramp up it will often throw in "decline" pushups near the end of the workout. I can't do that after doing 8 sets of pushups, I'll fall on my face! Fortunately it lets you reorder and replace exercises before the workout starts.

Haven't tried the paid version but the free version has been wonderful! Far better than most apps I've tried. This one has one ad at the end of my daily workout routine and keeps a quiz at the end of each session to figure out how to alter future workouts for me. It's tailored to my needs, has great workouts, and no noticable bugs. Great app!!

I hate going to the gym for a number of reasons. If you're like me then you'll probably love this app. Beginner, Intermediate and Advanced levels of body weight exercises (hand weights optional) that at least make you sweat. Organized sequences with timers or reps make it super easy. I want to feel good and lose the dad bod now that I'm in my forties. This app is getting me there. Hopefully it will for you, too!

I haven't really exercised since ninth grade PE, which I did online so most of it was faked. I'm out of shape, bit of pudge here and there. I have a really hard time with motivation and this app is awesome with it's reminders like it's shaming me for sitting around, it's awesome. The adjusted workouts with beginner, intermediate, advanced are great. I'm exhausted every day, whixh is great. After years of stagnation, I worked out 90 minutes this week!

I use this app several times per week. It's great! It is quick, and ads are unobtrusive once you're started on your routine. To get from Beginner level to Intermediate level is a bit of a leap. For me, I progressed by doing more reps on each exercise in the Beginner level before trying Intermediate. I do wish there was a way to integrate this app with Google Fit or another fitness tracker. Update: it has a button to sync with Google Fit. Works great!

This is a great app, been using it for a long time. It's normally a solid 4/5 but please, if you have to force us to watch unstoppable minute long ads, put it at the end of the workout, not the beginning. It's very intrusive to the overall user experience. If you have to have long ads, put the short still image or skippable ads at the beginning. Not the long and obtrusive ones.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Ian, sorry for your bad experience. We have communicated your suggestions to our development team and will consider finding a way to display ads without disturbing you. Hope you can understand and support us‚ù§Ô∏è.Best wishes.

scraped_reviews.content: I haven't tried an app like this onez but I really do like it. Just the right exercise lengths, good information, I like that it includes stretches, the daily routine is varied which avoids boredom and allows your muscles time to recover. I like that you can raise up or down the challenge. I do wish there was a tutorial mode however. To give you more detailed instructions during the routine. A few exercises are not intuitive and it's hard to remember when to breathe and which muscle to flex.

I used to love this app but somewhere along the way, they started making you have to watch videos just to do a good workout ONCE. After that, you have to pay 40 dollars yearly just to use a workout more than once. I remember being able to use a workout, no matter which one, with no worries of paying and with an ad at the end. I was fine with it. Will not change my review unless they change this app. Severely disappointed.

The total body workout is pretty decent for beginners, and I like how you can adjust the intensity by telling the app if it is too easy or too hard. The biggest downside for me is that there are no pre-workout stretches and very few in-workout (or "post", as it is at the end of the actual exercises) stretches. For a true beginner, they are setting themselves up for extra pain and potential strains to improperly prepared muscle groups.

Straight forward, good beginner exercises with stretching. One ad at the end of a whole routine. NON-INTUSIVE. I can't stress this enough. The ads are so acceptable. I HATE ads, can't stand them. I've barely noticed these. I've done the 4 beginner routines for a week now and hove no complaints. It offers reminders if you're into that sort of thing and the calendar and workout history are perfect for a beginner looking to build consistency.

Great exercises. Bad app. Even though I paid for the yearly membership it still makes me "unlock" exercises every day, doesn't remember my favorite exercises (which it did before) and forces me to watch ads like when I was in the trial period. I have no idea how to contact the app developer to get this fixed. Love the exercises. Can't stand the app.

Ads can be somewhat ill timed. When you select a workout an ad will, at times, pop up before bringing up your selection. I have ADHD so getting motivation is difficult to manage. So when I have it and I need to jump right in, the extra wait from an unexpected ad can kill my momentum. Otherwise, the app is great. Workouts are great. Easy to navigate.

This app is great. It really helped me get into the groove of muscle training. There are a few downsides, but none of them are major. Sometimes the exercises can be a bit difficult to properly perform, even with the app's instructions. Also, I'm not entirely sure which exercise sets I should pick for certain purposes. After doing the upper body challenge, I'm not entirely sure where to go next. But I seem to be figuring it out as I go, so it probbaly won't be much of an inconvenience in the end.

This app has good workouts, and a good system to teach you workouts that you may not have done. There is an ad at the beginning and end of most workouts, but these ads are usually skipable after 5 seconds. There are small pop up ads during some exercises, but they are so small you probably won't notice them. My only complaint is that the buttons are very small and can make this app annoying to use if your hands are shaking. All things considered, pretty good body weight workout app.

Wish there was a way to bookmark or favorite certain workouts and routines so you can organize them instead of constantly having to go to the discover page and scrolling to find it every single time. And maybe a way to save stretches/warm-ups separately from your workout so it doesn't track it as part of your weekly workout. Otherwise it's good if you already know what you're doing and what you're looking for. Super basic

I like the app overall, but there are a couple of things that I don't like about it. The first is the number of calories burned per workout. It's entirely unrealistic. I trust my smart watch more than I do the app, especially when it says I burned over 90 calories just doing body weight exercises. My watch said 32 calories were burned. The burning of over 90 calories in only a few minutes requires a much, much higher heart rate. My next complaint, too many ads. Way too many.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Natalie, thanks for your valuable feedback. We attach great importance to user's needs and we have communicated your suggestions to our development team. The advertisements displayed are a means to support the free services and features. We are continually trying to keep them as unobtrusive as possible while maintaining our free app service.

scraped_reviews.content: A good variety of exercises with plenty of variety on options... Set a reminder for your next workout, difficulty, which muscle group(s) you want to work out, and the list goes on. This is my second time through it and I happily came back. I wish they changed the name of "full body workout" to "lower body workout" as I missed my lower body the first several days last time.

Home Workout - No Equipment is a game-changer for fitness enthusiasts. The exercises are well-structured, effective, and perfect for all levels. No gym? No problem! The guided routines and clear animations keep me motivated every day. The variety ensures no boredom, and progress tracking is a huge plus. Highly recommended for anyone serious about staying fit at home! üí™üî•

Great at home workouts with many stretching exercises. Also has a challenge routine that gradually increases the workout time/intensity. However, once you complete a month, you are left with the same workout as the last day. You should not rely on the calorie counter because it counts minutes required to complete the exercise (irrespective of the ec exercise I suspect) and if for example, you leave the app open and are interrupted, it can show even say 900 Kcal of energy burned üòÜ.

I've been using it for basically five years! It started as a pandemic-era practicality that turned into a daily routine. It's very effective at keeping up your fitness levels; especially if you, for whatever reason, have to be indoors with no equipment. Ideal for travel, home workouts, and it includes great templates for gym workouts. Plus, every workout, as well as workout plan, is fully customizable.

Excellent app. I must say that I learned a lot from this app. The best thing which I loved about the app is that they don't just gave an exercise to do, they also gave a lot of information about exercise (like how to perform, effective areas, common mistakes and also a video guide) that brings clarity in the users. It will be better if there is a separate area or section where you can search any exercise and learn about it. Overall the app is very good and useful.

Only been using it for a few weeks, but I already opted for the membership. It's been a huge help keeping me on schedule, and I love that I can download/add workouts to fit my needs. Also, if there's an exercise you're not familiar with, it provides video and instructions to help you. It's like having a virtual personal trainer, which is exactly what I was looking for. If something in the scheduled workout is too difficult (or easy) you can swap it out. Fully customizable. 5 stars!

this workout app has a good user interface, nice design. it has moving images and a voice assistant that tells you exactly what to do to get the most out of your workout. And if you think it's too hard or too easy, you can just tell the system to adjust your workout difficulty. I find mine just perfect. let's see what I become by month end.

I do not expect miracles The app targets arms, chest and abs. No leg day so far. The good side, the app gets me to be active most days for an extra 20 minutes or so. The motivation still has to come from the user. Decent exercises without any equipment other than a mat and a chair or bench. 3 day cycle, day one is rather push up intensive. It will help my fitness level during the winter days, but I am not expecting miracles
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We are currently reviewing our workout plans to ensure they offer variety and focus on balanced development across all muscle groups. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us improve and we have communicated it to our development team.

scraped_reviews.content: Great free app w tons of info, tips & videos & swap out exercises, within limits (see below). Main downsides: 1. Full body plan: most full bodies have legs! Add lower body exercises or rename! 2. Pushups male centric. Female muscles differ & "easier" workouts impossible. Swapouts mostly more pushup variations! Have realistic workouts for female bodies! 3. Free access unintuitive: don't mislead with many questions relevant only to paid. At end, exit, go back in & free access but ignores answers
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we understand that everyone has different fitness levels and recovery needs. Your suggestion is valid and something we will definitely consider. Your satisfaction is our priority, and we are continuously working to improve the app to meet the diverse needs of our users. Thank you for helping us become better.

scraped_reviews.content: This is a great app for home workouts ,it has an exceptional setting with a great range of workouts from beginners level to pro's level. Very nice range of workouts for every muscle. Results? Unbelievable! You just need patience, persistence and consistency to achieve desired results. I wish you could add an option for discarding in-app music üéµ I don't like
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thanks for contacting us and we'd like to help you out. While exercising, you can tap the music button on the right upper corner of the animation (next to the sound button) to turn off the music. Hope this helps. Any other questions or problems, please feel free to contact us again. Best regards.

scraped_reviews.content: Attention: This app has revolutionized my workout routine, allowing me to optimize my time and environment. Regardless of my physical surroundings or time constraints, I can adapt the I've learned to navigate any workout and switch ups. It's a stroke of luck to have this app - it's the best for a quick workout setup. Not only it is great for training but you can use for navigating. I've upgraded my exercises from previous aerobics, and it provides great guidance in terms of alignment and grids.

Best workout app I've been training with! I used few aps and there was always something wrong, not enough settings, not enough flexibility, exercises were not good enough, etc. since I've started training with home workout I'm just exhausted! there is so many options, plans and flexibility with re-arranging things so you can build your perfect workout. Free version is good, not packed with adds, not interrupting training just great. Premium is very reasonably priced as well.

If you want to call it a very well-organized gym base exercise app for home use, then this is it. It has many amazing features available in it which are helpful for every user. There are different sections and customizable options available for all types of people, whether they are new users or bodybuilders. Personally, I like it a lot.

This app helped me a lot in get going from start. guys plz refer the video which is there in the app before doing any exercise. ... Only 1 suggestion for developers to ask for any prior injuries like back pain or sciatica is not there and then suggests the plan. ... Another point is there introduce some light stretching (like arms movement , shoulder movement , legs stretching , etc) in between the exercises , At the Start and at the End you have provided which is also very good
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, thanks for your valuable feedback. We attach great importance to user's needs and we have communicated your suggestions to our development team. Thanks for your support. We'll continue to improve our app to bring you a better experience. Best regards.

It is, however, extremely frustrating because of the excessive number of items from different merge groups that come from the same producer & the extremely excessive amount of energy bars needed to get 1 item of a challenge. Energy and diamonds are very expensive and deplete quickly. The game is definitely designed to separate you from your money. I understand that the creators of the game want to make money, but I think they could do better by the customers.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for taking the time to rate us. We‚Äôre constantly introducing new and fun features and events, and we hope you‚Äôll enjoy them. Our Support Team (https://support.traveltowngame.com/hc/en-us?utm_source=app_store&utm_medium=review&utm_campaign=mixed2) is available 24/7, and we love getting our players‚Äô feedback so feel free to rea...

scraped_reviews.content: An update should be something good. In this case, it felt like a kick in the face. Fire cards? It would've been great if those were given equally with the regular cards, but they only have shortened the chances of completing albums. TOO MANY REPEATED CARDS, now it is impossible to complete anything. Three days to complete an order since producers will give the 2nd or 3rd wave of items when and IF they please. Save the bot's copy-pasted auto replay and REALLY revise the last update.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! We‚Äôre sorry to hear you had this experience with the game. Our Support Team will be happy to help you with this.

scraped_reviews.content: Fun game, graphics are beautiful and there's always some kind of interesting event going on. I feel like the energy takes too long to regenerate though. I can't play for more than 5‚Äì10 minutes at a time unless I purchase diamonds, and it's tedious to wait several hours between sessions only to not accomplish anything because the energy stops regenerating at 100, which usually isn't enough to complete a goal.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Rainy! We‚Äôre glad to see you‚Äôre enjoying Travel Town and appreciate your feedback. We‚Äôll make sure to take it into consideration as we work to improve the game. Feel free to reach out to our Support Team if you need any further assistance. üì®

scraped_reviews.content: Horribly boring. Although the generators refill at a decent pace, they empty so fast that it truly does not justify what a chore it is to play. The generators themselves also don't produce higher level items like other games, so that compared with that your base 100 energy is gone within three minutes of playtime, I absolutely would not recommend downloading this.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for your feedback. It's extremely important to our team that our players have the best experience possible, and we're constantly working to achieve this.

scraped_reviews.content: I've been playing for a while, been having fun with it for the most part, how ever a recent update/change has added extra items in the middle of a merge chain. This has now caused issues with progressing and made it so hitting temporary goals are either nearly impossible or require paid transactions to complete within the time frame. It is one thing to add another link to the merge chain at the end but to add it in the middle just to make it take extra energy before getting a dispenser item?
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! We're glad to hear you've been enjoying Travel Town. We appreciate your feedback regarding the recent update and the changes to the merge chain, and we'll certainly take it into consideration as we work to improve the game. Please feel free to reach out to our [Support Team](https://support.traveltowngame.com/hc/?utm_source=app_store&u...

scraped_reviews.content: Good game. The only thing that I don't like is when things like "Steven's Disco" come around, you never TRULY get a chance at higher prizes without paying for it. I ALWAYS land on the 25 energy...NEVER anything better. That makes this come across as rigged to me, and if you don't have the chance for anything better without paying for it, then we're better off without it.

I had rated you at 5 üåü, but I'm changing it to 2 üåü. Your game is absolutely fun...I'll give you that. The problem is to truly finish orders and compete you have to purchase gems and energy. I won't be spending anymore on your game. I'm not advertising the game, but check out Tasty Travels and their mechanics. I've bought gems and energy there, but they allow you to win energy and gems so you don't have to spend money every day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi there! Thank you for taking the time to rate us. We‚Äôre constantly introducing new and fun features and events, and we hope you‚Äôll enjoy them. Our Support Team (https://support.traveltowngame.com/hc/en-us?utm_source=app_store&utm_medium=review&utm_campaign=mixed2) is available 24/7, and we love getting our players‚Äô feedback so feel free to rea...

scraped_reviews.content: I do love playing the game, but I spend money on energy and it's very addictive. I think a 100 in energy that we are given most of the time gets me nowhere, because I have to use at least 4√ó the energy to complete tasks. The cards we get and trade are another problem. We get more duplicates than cards to complete the sets. I feel like since I do love the game and I play every day and spend money that I really shouldn't, it should be more generous with energy and everything else.

just load the ads! it's not that hard. you have an ad ready for me to watch. so just play it. but no, 95% of the time the ad loads but does not play. so an "error" happens, "try again later" appears on screen. so I have to close the app, reopen, and try to watch the ad again. sometimes I have to repeat this 4 times before the ad loads and I get my reward. so stop this nonsense and just play the ads. no I do not have network issues, the game servers are not down, there are lots of ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey there! We‚Äôre sorry to hear you had this experience with the game. Our Support Team will be happy to help you with this.

scraped_reviews.content: I really enjoy this game! It's fun and addictive and for someone like myself who loses interest after a month with most monotonous games, this means a lot. I just truly wish there were ways to message and request for cards in app, its a bit annoying to need to join a social group to ask for these. Maybe its coming in another update, but I'd love to see it added. Also, it would be nice to have other options to buy energy, not just the 10, 20, 40 diamonds or the energy box for 24, 48 diamonds.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hey Mary! We‚Äôre glad to see you‚Äôre enjoying Travel Town and appreciate your feedback. We‚Äôll make sure to take it into consideration as we work to improve the game. Feel free to reach out to our [Support Team](https://support.traveltowngame.com/hc/?utm_source=app_store&utm_medium=review&utm_campaign=mixed1) if you need any further assistance.

title: Instagram
description:
Little moments lead to big friendships. Share yours on Instagram. 
‚ÄîFrom Meta

Connect with friends, find other fans, and see what people around you are up to and into. Explore your interests and post what's going on, from your daily moments to life's highlights.

Share what you‚Äôre up to and into on Insta¬Æ.
- Keep up with friends on the fly with Stories and Notes that disappear after 24 hours.
- Start group chats and share unfiltered moments with your Close Friends.
- Share memories from recent events or trips in Feed.
- Turn your life into a movie and discover short, entertaining videos on Instagram with Reels.
- Customize your posts with exclusive templates, music, stickers and filters.

Dive into your interests.
- Watch videos from your favorite Creators and discover new content that‚Äôs personalized to your interests.
- Get inspired by photos and videos from new accounts in Explore.
- Discover brands and small businesses, and shop products that are relevant to your personal style.

Some Instagram features may not be available in your country or region.

Terms and Policies - https://help.instagram.com/581066165581870

Consumer Health Privacy Policy: https://privacycenter.instagram.com/policies/health

Learn how we're working to help keep our communities safe across Meta technologies at the Instagram Safety Center: https://about.instagram.com/safety
